dm:document.description: DM instance that illustrates USP commands. {{issue|We need to decide what spec URN prefix to use (going forward) for CWMP/USP data models.}}

dataType.name: IPAddress
dataType.description: IP address, i.e. IPv4 address (or IPv4 subnet mask) or IPv6 address. All IPv4 addresses and subnet masks MUST be represented as strings in IPv4 dotted-decimal notation. Here are some examples of valid IPv4 address textual representations: * 216.52.29.100 * 192.168.1.254 All IPv6 addresses MUST be represented using any of the 3 standard textual representations defined in {{bibref|RFC4291}} Sections 2.2.1, 2.2.2 and 2.2.3. Both lower-case and upper-case letters can be used, but use of lower-case letters is RECOMMENDED. Here are some examples of valid IPv6 address textual representations: * 1080:0:0:800:ba98:3210:11aa:12dd * 1080::800:ba98:3210:11aa:12dd * 0:0:0:0:0:0:13.1.68.3 IPv6 addresses MUST NOT include zone identifiers. Zone identifiers are discussed in {{bibref|RFC4007|Section 6}}. Unspecified or inapplicable addresses (or IPv4 subnet masks) MUST be represented as empty strings unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition.

dataType.name: IPv4Address
dataType.description: IPv4 address (or subnet mask). Can be any IPv4 address that is permitted by the ''IPAddress'' data type.

dataType.name: IPv6Address
dataType.description: IPv6 address. Can be any IPv6 address that is permitted by the ''IPAddress'' data type.

dataType.name: IPPrefix
dataType.description: IPv4 or IPv6 routing prefix in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation {{bibref|RFC4632}}. This is specified as an IP address followed by an appended "/n" suffix, where ''n'' (the prefix size) is an integer in the range 0-32 (for IPv4) or 0-128 (for IPv6) that indicates the number of (leftmost) '1' bits of the routing prefix. * IPv4 example: 192.168.1.0/24 * IPv6 example: 2001:edff:fe6a:f76::/64 If the IP address part is unspecified or inapplicable, it MUST be {{empty}} unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition. In this case the IP prefix will be of the form "/n". If the entire IP prefix is unspecified or inapplicable, it MUST be {{empty}} unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition.

dataType.name: IPv4Prefix
dataType.description: IPv4 address prefix. Can be any IPv4 prefix that is permitted by the ''IPPrefix'' data type.

dataType.name: IPv6Prefix
dataType.description: IPv6 address prefix. Can be any IPv6 prefix that is permitted by the ''IPPrefix'' data type.

dataType.name: MACAddress
dataType.description: All MAC addresses are represented as strings of 12 hexadecimal digits (digits 0-9, letters A-F or a-f) displayed as six pairs of digits separated by colons. Unspecified or inapplicable MAC addresses MUST be represented as empty strings unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition.

dataType.name: StatsCounter32
dataType.description: A 32-bit statistics parameter, e.g. a byte counter. This data type SHOULD NOT be used for statistics parameters whose values might become greater than the maximum value that can be represented as an ''unsignedInt'' (i.e. 0xffffffff, referred to below as ''maxval''). ''StatsCounter64'' SHOULD be used for such parameters. The value ''maxval'' indicates that no data is available for this parameter. In the unlikely event that the actual value of the statistic is ''maxval'', the CPE SHOULD return ''maxval - 1''. The actual value of the statistic might be greater than ''maxval''. Such values SHOULD wrap around through zero. The term ''packet'' is to be interpreted as the transmission unit appropriate to the protocol layer in question, e.g. an IP packet or an Ethernet frame.

dataType.name: StatsCounter64
dataType.description: A 64-bit statistics parameter, e.g. a byte counter. This data type SHOULD be used for all statistics parameters whose values might become greater than the maximum value that can be represented as an ''unsignedInt''. The maximum value that can be represented as an ''unsignedLong'' (i.e. 0xffffffffffffffff) indicates that no data is available for this parameter. The term ''packet'' is to be interpreted as the transmission unit appropriate to the protocol layer in question, e.g. an IP packet or an Ethernet frame.

dataType.name: _AliasCommon
dataType.description: A non-volatile handle used to reference this instance. '''This is intended only for use in protocol-independent "common" definitions, and MUST NOT be used in protocol-specific definitions.'''

dataType.name: _AliasCWMP
dataType.description: A non-volatile handle used to reference this instance. Alias provides a mechanism for an ACS to label this instance for future reference. If the CPE supports the Alias-based Addressing feature as defined in {{bibref|TR-069a4|3.6.1}} and described in {{bibref|TR-069a4|Appendix II}}, the following mandatory constraints MUST be enforced: * Its value MUST NOT be empty. * Its value MUST start with a letter. * If its value is not assigned by the ACS, it MUST start with a "cpe-" prefix. * The CPE MUST NOT change the parameter value.

dataType.name: _AliasUSP
dataType.description: A non-volatile unique key used to reference this instance. Alias provides a mechanism for a Controller to label this instance for future reference. The following mandatory constraints MUST be enforced: * The value MUST NOT be empty. * The value MUST start with a letter. * If the value is not assigned by the Controller at creation time, the Agent MUST assign a value with an "cpe-" prefix. The value MUST NOT change once it's been assigned.

dataType.name: Alias
dataType.description: A non-volatile handle used to reference this instance. Alias provides a mechanism for an ACS to label this instance for future reference. If the CPE supports the Alias-based Addressing feature as defined in {{bibref|TR-069a4|3.6.1}} and described in {{bibref|TR-069a4|Appendix II}}, the following mandatory constraints MUST be enforced: * Its value MUST NOT be empty. * Its value MUST start with a letter. * If its value is not assigned by the ACS, it MUST start with a "cpe-" prefix. * The CPE MUST NOT change the parameter value.

dataType.name: Dbm1000
dataType.description: The value is measured in ''dBm/1000'', i.e. the value divided by 1000 is dB relative to 1 mW. For example, -12345 means -12.345 dBm, 0 means 0 dBm (1 mW) and 12345 means 12.345 dBm.

dataType.name: IEEE_EUI64
dataType.description: The IEEE EUI 64-bit identifier as defined in {{bibref|EUI64}}. The IEEE defined 64-bit extended unique identifier (EUI-64) is a concatenation of: * The 24-bit (OUI-24) or 36-bit (OUI-36) company_id value assigned by the IEEE Registration Authority (IEEE-RA), and * The extension identifier (40 bits for OUI-24 or 28 bits for OUI-36) assigned by the organization with that company_id assignment.

dataType.name: ZigBeeNetworkAddress
dataType.description: The ZigBee 16-bit network address (NWK) as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007}}. The address is assigned to a device by the network layer and used by the network layer for routing messages between devices.

dataType.name: DiagnosticsState
dataType.description: Indicates the availability of diagnostics data. Enumeration of: {{enum}} If the ACS sets the value of this parameter to {{enum|Requested}}, the CPE MUST initiate the corresponding diagnostic test. When writing, the only allowed values are {{enum|Requested}} and {{enum|Canceled}}. To ensure the use of the proper test parameters (the writable parameters in this object), the test parameters MUST be set, and any errors or inconsistencies in the test parameters MUST be detected, either prior to or at the same time as (in the same SetParameterValues) setting this parameter to {{enum|Requested}}. When requested, the CPE SHOULD wait until after completion of the communication session with the ACS before starting the diagnostic test. When the test is completed, the value of this parameter MUST be either {{enum|Complete}} (if the test completed successfully), or one of the ''Error'' values listed above. If the value of this parameter is anything other than {{enum|Complete}}, the values of the results parameters for this test are indeterminate. When the diagnostic initiated by the ACS is completed (successfully or not), but not if it is canceled for any reason, the CPE MUST establish a new connection to the ACS to allow the ACS to view the results, indicating the Event code ''8 DIAGNOSTICS COMPLETE'' in the Inform message. After the diagnostic is complete, the value of all result parameters (all read-only parameters in this object) MUST be retained by the CPE until either this diagnostic is run again, or the CPE reboots. After a reboot, if the CPE has not retained the result parameters from the most recent test, it MUST set the value of this parameter to {{enum|None}}. Modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the test being terminated and the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, setting this parameter to {{enum|Requested}} (and possibly modifying other writable parameters in this object) MUST result in the test being terminated and then restarted using the current values of the test parameters. While the test is in progress, setting this parameter to {{enum|Canceled}} MUST result in the test being canceled and the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. If the CPE does not support the {{enum|Canceled}} value, it MUST return a SPV error with "Invalid Parameter value" (9007) to the ACS instead.

dataType.name: JSONObject
dataType.description: A JSON Object as defined in {{bibref|RFC7159|Section 4}}.

reference.name: RFC 4122
reference.title: A Universally Unique IDentifier (UUID) URN Namespace

reference.name: RFC 4632
reference.title: Classless Inter-domain Routing (CIDR): The Internet Address Assignment and Aggregation Plan

reference.name: RFC7159
reference.title: The JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) Data Interchange Format

reference.name: TR-106 Amendment 7
reference.title: Data Model Template for TR-069-Enabled Devices

object.name: Device.
object.description: The top-level object for a Device.

command.name: Reboot()
command.description: Reboot the entity associated with the containing {{object}}.

object.name: Device.LocalAgent.
object.description: This object contains general information about the USP Agent itself...

command.name: Reboot()
command.description: Reboot the entity associated with the containing {{object}}.

command.name: FactoryReset()
command.description: Factory reset the entity associated with the containing {{object}}.

command.name: Download()
command.description: Download a file to the entity associated with the containing {{object}}. {{issue|Need to include all necessary normative text that (for CWMP) is in A.3.2.8.}}

input.description: {{issue|The CWMP ''FileType'' input argument is omitted because it will be implied by the command's location in the data model.}} {{issue|The CWMP ''SuccessURL'' and ''FailureURL'' input arguments are omitted because they are no longer relevant (if they ever were).}}

parameter.name: URL
parameter.description: URL, as defined in {{bibref|RFC3986}}, specifying the source file location...

parameter.name: Username
parameter.description: Username to be used by the CPE to authenticate with the file server. This string is set to {{empty}} if no authentication is required.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: Password to be used by the CPE to authenticate with the file server. This string is set to {{empty}} if no authentication is required.

parameter.name: FileSize
parameter.description: The size of the file to be downloaded in bytes. The {{param}} argument is intended as a hint to the CPE, which the CPE MAY use to determine if it has sufficient space for the file to be downloaded, or to prepare space to accept the file. ...

parameter.name: TargetFileName
parameter.description: The name of the file to be used on the target file system...

parameter.name: DelaySeconds
parameter.description: This argument has different meanings for Unicast and Multicast downloads...

parameter.name: StartTime
parameter.description: The date and time transfer was started in UTC. The CPE SHOULD record this information and report it in this argument, but if this information is not available, the value of this argument MUST be set to the Unknown Time value.

parameter.name: CompleteTime
parameter.description: The date and time the transfer was fully completed and applied in UTC. This need only be filled in if the transfer has been fully completed and applied. The CPE SHOULD record this information and report it in this argument, but if this information is not available or the transfer has not completed, the value of this argument MUST be set to the Unknown Time value.

object.name: FaultStruct.
object.description: Fault Structure. If the transfer was successful, the {{param|FaultCode}} is set to zero. Otherwise a non-zero {{param|FaultCode}} is specified along with a {{param|FaultString}} indicating the failure reason.

parameter.name: FaultCode
parameter.description: The numerical fault code...

parameter.name: FaultString
parameter.description: A human-readable text description of the fault. This field SHOULD be empty if the FaultCode equals 0 (zero).

command.name: Upload()
command.description: Upload a file from the entity associated with the containing {{object}}. {{issue|Need to include all necessary normative text that (for CWMP) is in A.4.1.5.}}

input.description: {{issue|The CWMP ''FileType'' input argument is omitted because it will be implied by the command's location in the data model.}}

parameter.name: URL
parameter.description: URL, as defined in {{bibref|RFC3986}}, specifying the destination file location...

parameter.name: Username
parameter.description: Username to be used by the CPE to authenticate with the file server. This string is set to {{empty}} if no authentication is required.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: Password to be used by the CPE to authenticate with the file server. This string is set to {{empty}} if no authentication is required.

parameter.name: DelaySeconds
parameter.description: The number of seconds from the time this method is called to the time the CPE is requested to initiate the upload...

parameter.name: StartTime
parameter.description: The date and time transfer was started in UTC. The CPE SHOULD record this information and report it in this argument, but if this information is not available, the value of this argument MUST be set to the Unknown Time value.

parameter.name: CompleteTime
parameter.description: The date and time the transfer was fully completed and applied in UTC. This need only be filled in if the transfer has been fully completed and applied. The CPE SHOULD record this information and report it in this argument, but if this information is not available or the transfer has not completed, the value of this argument MUST be set to the Unknown Time value.

object.name: FaultStruct.
object.description: Fault Structure. If the transfer was successful, the {{param|FaultCode}} is set to zero. Otherwise a non-zero {{param|FaultCode}} is specified along with a {{param|FaultString}} indicating the failure reason.

parameter.name: FaultCode
parameter.description: The numerical fault code...

parameter.name: FaultString
parameter.description: A human-readable text description of the fault. This field SHOULD be empty if the FaultCode equals 0 (zero).

command.name: ScheduleTimer()

parameter.name: DelaySeconds
parameter.description: The number of seconds from the time this method is called to the time the CPE is requested to initiate a one-time... {{issue|CWMP ''ScheduleInform'' uses ''DelaySeconds'', but should this use an absolute time?}}

parameter.name: ControllerNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: RequestNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.LocalAgent.Controller.{i}.
object.description: Each instance of this table represents a USP Controller that has access to this USP Agent...

object.name: Device.LocalAgent.Request.{i}.
object.description: {{object}} instances are created using USP Operate messages. Only Operate messages with ''async''={{true}} will create a {{object}} instance in the data model...

object.name: Device.LocalAgent.Request.{i}.Transfer.
object.description: {{issue|Experimental illustration of how the ''Request'' table could include command-specific information.}} {{issue|This is closely related to the ''TransferComplete!'' event, but exists only for transfers requested via USP... which perhaps makes the point that if this information is needed then it should be in a table that lists information about all transfers, regardless of whether they were requested via USP?}}

object.name: Device.SoftwareModules.
object.description: Top level object for dynamically managed software applications.

parameter.name: ExecEnvNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: DeploymentUnitNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: ExecutionUnitNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.SoftwareModules.ExecEnv.{i}.
object.description: The Execution Environments that are available on the device, along with their properties and configurable settings.

command.name: Install()

parameter.name: URL
parameter.description: The URL, as defined in {{bibref|RFC3986}}, that specifies the location of the DU to be installed...

parameter.name: UUID
parameter.description: The UUID (see {{bibref|RFC4122}}) of the DU to be installed...

parameter.name: Username
parameter.description: Username to be used by the CPE to authenticate with the file server, if authentication is required.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: Password to be used by the CPE to authenticate with the file server, if authentication is required.

object.name: Operation.{i}.
object.description: The results of Operations performed against DUs. {{issue|Is ''UUID'' a unique key?}}

parameter.name: UUID
parameter.description: The UUID as defined in {{bibref|RFC4122}} of the DU that was created.

parameter.name: DeploymentUnitRef
parameter.description: A reference to the DU that was created.

parameter.name: Version
parameter.description: The version of the DU created. This MUST match the {{param|.SoftwareModules.DeploymentUnit.{i}.Version}} Parameter contained within the instance of the DeploymentUnit that is contained within the {{param|DeploymentUnitRef}} argument.

parameter.name: CurrentState
parameter.description: The current state of the created DU.

enumeration.description: The DU is in an Installed state due to a successful Install.
The DU could not be installed in which case a DU instance MUST NOT be created in the Data Model.

parameter.name: Resolved
parameter.description: Whether or not the DU operation resolved all of its dependencies.

parameter.name: ExecutionUnitRefList
parameter.description: The Execution Units that were created as a result of the DU's installation.

parameter.name: StartTime
parameter.description: The date and time transfer was started in UTC. The CPE SHOULD record this information and report it in this argument, but if this information is not available, the value of this argument MUST be set to the Unknown Time value.

parameter.name: CompleteTime
parameter.description: The date and time the transfer was fully completed and applied in UTC. This need only be filled in if the transfer has been fully completed and applied. The CPE SHOULD record this information and report it in this argument, but if this information is not available or the transfer has not completed, the value of this argument MUST be set to the Unknown Time value.

object.name: Operation.{i}.Fault.
object.description: Fault Structure. If the operation was successful, the {{param|FaultCode}} MUST be zero. Otherwise a non-zero {{param|FaultCode}} is specified along with a {{param|FaultString}} indicating the failure reason.

parameter.name: FaultCode
parameter.description: The numerical fault code...

parameter.name: FaultString
parameter.description: A human-readable text description of the fault. This field SHOULD be empty if the FaultCode equals 0 (zero).

object.name: Device.SoftwareModules.DeploymentUnit.{i}.
object.description: This table serves as the Deployment Unit inventory and contains status information about each Deployment Unit...

parameter.name: Version
parameter.description: Version of this {{object}}. The format of this value is Execution Environment specific.

command.name: Update()
command.description: Update the associated {{object}}. {{issue|Output arguments are not shown. They are similar to those for ''Install()'', which are taken from ''DUStateChangeComplete''.}}

parameter.name: URL
parameter.description: The URL, as defined in {{bibref|RFC3986}}, that specifies the location of the update to be applied to the existing DU...

parameter.name: Username
parameter.description: Username to be used by the CPE to authenticate with the file server, if authentication is required.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: Password to be used by the CPE to authenticate with the file server, if authentication is required.

command.name: Uninstall()

object.name: Device.SoftwareModules.ExecutionUnit.{i}.
object.description: This table serves as the Execution Unit inventory and contains both status information about each Execution Unit...

profile.name: MandatoryCommands:1
profile.description: Mandatory commands that MUST be supported by all Agents. {{issue|This is just an example.}}
